data.title: Alabama Athletics
data.meta_description: Justin Jefferson (15) LB - 2023 Worked on special teams while also seeing time at linebacker ... totaled four tackles and a forced fumble in 14 games of acti...
data.text:
2023

Worked on special teams while also seeing time at linebacker ... totaled four tackles and a forced fumble in 14 games of action. Middle Tennessee: Saw his first action as a member of the Crimson Tide. Texas: Earned snaps on special teams against the Longhorns. USF: Worked on special teams in Tampa. Ole Miss: Forced a fumble with a huge hit on special teams. Mississippi State: Made one tackle on kickoff coverage against the Bulldogs. Texas A&M: Saw time on special teams in Bryan-College Station. Arkansas: Recorded one tackle on kickoff coverage. Tennessee: Worked on special teams against the Volunteers. LSU: Saw time on special teams. Kentucky: Finished with one tackle on the day. Chattanooga: Saw time against the Mocs. Auburn: Contributed on special teams in the Iron Bowl. Georgia: Continued his work on special teams against the Bulldogs. Michigan: Saw time on special teams in the Rose Bowl.

Prior to Alabama

One of the top junior college players in the 2023 recruiting cycle ... a unanimous four-star recruit who is also considered the second-ranked junior college recruit by all major outlets ... No. 2 on the 247Composite and the No. 1 JUCO linebacker ... the On3 Consensus ranked him second overall and as the No. 1 JUCO linebacker ... PrepStar Magazine ranked Jefferson as the No. 2 overall JUCO recruit, the No. 1 linebacker and No. 1 player in Kansas ... recorded 86 tackles as a sophomore for head coach Seth Smith at Pearl River C.C. in 2022 ... added two sacks and an interception ... made 57 stops in his freshman campaign with 13 tackles for loss and three sacks ... played for head coach Waldon Tucker at Bartlett High School in Memphis, Tenn., prior to arriving at Pearl River C.C. ... as a senior at Bartlett, recorded 116 tackles, including 74 solo stops and two interceptions ... chose Alabama over Auburn, Florida, Oregon and Texas A&M.
